intro: Campylocentrum stenanthum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved piper, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Piperaceae, which includes the pepper plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Campylocentrum stenanthum is often found in the understorey of tropical and subtropical forests.
